title: Rylan and Gary Barlow finally bury the hatchet
text:
They famously locked horns when Rylan appeared as an X Factor contestant on the in 2012 and judge Gary Barlow didn't think he was worthy of being on the show.

But seven years after Rylan came in fifth place on the ninth series and went on to become a TV presenter and a household name, the pair have healed their rift.

Rylan, 30, took to social media on Tuesday night to share a sweet picture of himself and Gary, 48, when they bumped into one another at the Specsavers party in London.

'After 7 years... we’re good': Rylan and Gary Barlow have finally buried the hatchet following their feud as they posed for a snap together at the Specsavers party in London on Tuesday

He captioned the image with the words: 'After 7 years... we’re good': ❤️ @officialgarybarlow.'

The men didn't hold back about their feelings for one another on the X Factor.

Gary famously stormed out of the studio when controversial act Rylan got through the first week of eliminations over his favourite act, Carolynne Poole.

Take That star Gary also once said to him: 'I'm glad you learned the trick that when you pull the mic away – we don't hear what you're singing.'

Ouch! Gary famously stormed out of the X Factor studio when controversial act Rylan got through the first week of eliminations over his favourite act, Carolynne Poole in 2012

Say what you think: But outspoken Rylan soon got his own back and accused him of being a bore

But outspoken Rylan soon got his own back and accused him of being a bore.

He once wrote on Twitter: 'I'd rather be 'absolute s***' than just stand there and sing the same old stuff every week on the spot… #boreme @GBarlowOfficial.'

Adding insult to injury, Rylan also got a fake tattoo of Gary's face on his back for a magazine shoot and referred to him as Gary 'Bore-low'.

Nothing to see here: Now happily made up, Gary had a big smile on his face as he posed for snaps at the party

Walking tall: He looked smart in his grey suit and striped tie as he posed on the purple carpet

Alright now: It's not the first public spat Gary has had. He famously fell out with Robbie Williams when they were both in Take That

It's not the first public spat Gary has had.

He famously fell out with Robbie Williams when they were both in Take That.

Gary later said that making up with Robbie was 'like an exorcism' and they both admitted: 'I'm a d***.'

Robbie later admitted he was 'angry' with his bandmates, but mostly Gary - for not helping him with his well-documented issues when he quit the group in 1995.

Looking good: Rylan looked very dapper at the party wearing his trademark all black ensemble
description: They famously locked horns when Rylan appeared as an X Factor contestant on the  in 2012 and judge Gary Barlow didn't think he was worthy of being on the show.
